body: $PQEFF Oil will be breaking over $100 and PQEFF would have been trading higher than .59 on its own without the offer.  Viston isn't doing us a favor locking us down at .59 a share.  Oil movement and the winds prevailing are in our favor going forward and Viston knows this.  They saw PQEFF moving up
created_at: on its own (up to .25) and they pulled the trigger with a lowball offer and now they capped us at .59 a share.  Garbage.  They need to raise their offer especially considering there are shareholders (like me) who have invested in PQEFF years ago at higher than a $1 per share.  Not taking a loss.

body: $PQEFF great disclaimer. Sand btw is everywhere. Literally. It's more about logistics and who you are selling to. Most companies are using in basin sand so Uinta would be their only market
Broadlands based their economic analysis on information orally conveyed to them and no testing of sands from the Indago Lease has been performed by Broadland or by the Company.
Broadlands confirmed that they performed their analysis in general accordance with acceptable mineral industry standards
created_at: and that technical issues discussed in the Report are in accordance with the standards of Subpart 1300 of Regulation S-K ("SEC S-K 1300") promulgated by the Securities and Exchange Commission.

body: In particular
